New Records: Francisco Lindor hit a grand slam in the sixth inning, driving in four runs and securing the Mets' victory over the Phillies in Game 4 of the NLDS.
Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor's grand slam in the sixth inning was the turning point of the game, turning a 1-0 deficit into a 4-1 lead.
Post-Match Reflections: Francisco Lindor expressed his desire to win the championship and highlighted the team's journey to the playoffs.
Mets manager Carlos Mendoza praised the organization and the fans, emphasizing the team's resilience.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game marked the first home clincher in Citi Field's 16-season history.
The Phillies, as the NL East champions, struggled in the playoffs, securing only one victory.
